revisions.*:
'''Robert James Elliott''' (born 1940) is a [[United Kingdom|British]]-[[Canadian]] [[mathematician]], known for his contributions to [[control theory]], [[game theory]], [[stochastic processes]] and [[mathematical finance]].

He was schooled at [[Swanwick, Derbyshire]] and studied mathematics
in which he earn a [[Bachelor of Arts|B.A.]] (1961) and [[Master of Arts (Oxbridge and Dublin)|M.A.]] (1965) at the [[University of Oxford]], as well as a [[Doctor of Philosophy|Ph.D]] (thesis ''Some results in spectral synthesis'' advised by John Hunter Williamson, 1965)<ref>[http://genealogy.math.ndsu.nodak.edu/id.php?id=44801 entry] at [[Mathematics Genealogy Project]]</ref> and [[Doctor_of_Science#The_Commonwealth_of_Nations_and_Ireland|Sc.D.]] (1983) from [[University of Cambridge]].<ref>[http://www.ucalgary.ca/~relliott/index.html homepage]</ref>
He taught and conducted research at
[[Newcastle University|University of Newcastle]] (1964),
[[Yale University]] (1965–66),
[[University of Oxford]] (1966–68),
[[University of Warwick]] (1969–73),
[[Northwestern University]] (1972–73),
[[University of Hull]] (1973–86),
[[University of Alberta]] (1985-2001),
[[University of Calgary]] (2001-2009) and
[[University of Adelaide]] (2009-2013).

He is the cousin of physicist [[Roger James Elliott]].{{cn|date=October 2014}}

==Books==
*''Stochastic Processes, Finance and Control A Festschrift in Honor of Robert J Elliott'' ([[World Scientific Publishing]], 2012)
*with [[Nigel Kalton]], ''The Existence of Value for Differential Games'' ([[American Mathematical Society]], 1972) 
*''Stochastic Calculus and Applications'' ([[Springer-Verlag]], 1982)
*''Viscosity Solutions and Optimal Control'' ([[Longman]], 1987)
*''Stokasticheski Analiz i evo Prilozeniya'' (M.I.R. Publications Moscow, 1986)
*with [[Lakhdar Aggoun]] and [[John B. Moore (engineer)|John B. Moore]], ''Hidden Markov Models: Estimation and Control'' ([[Springer-Verlag]], 1994)
*with [[P. Ekkehard Kopp]], ''Mathematics of Financial Markets'' ([[Springer Verlag]], 1999, in Hungarian 2000). 
*with J. van der Hoek, ''Binomial Models in Finance'' ([[Springer Verlag]], 2005)
*with [[Rogemar Mamon|Rogemar S. Mamon]], ''Hidden Markov Models in Finance'' ([[Springer Science+Business Media|Springer]], 2007)
*with Samuel N. Cohen, ''Stochastic Calculus and Applications'' ([[Springer Science+Business Media|Springer]], 2015)
